rocket_relations

rocket_relations
  • rocket_relations 0.1.0 documentation

Welcome to rocket_relations

This package provides formulas for evaluating ideal rocket flow relations, including characteristic velocity (c*) and thrust coefficient (c_f) under calorically perfect gas and isentropic nozzle assumptions.

rocket_relations package

Submodules

rocket_relations.ideal module

ideal.py

Ideal rocket equations from part (c) of HW5, computing c* and C_F under the assumptions: calorically perfect gas,isentropic flow, steady quasi-1D nozzle expansion, and choked throat conditions.

Functions

c_star(gamma, R, T0)

Computes the ideal characteristic velocity c* [m/s]

c_f(gamma, pe_p0, pa_p0, Ae_Astar)

Computes the ideal thrust coefficient C_F (dimensionless)

rocket_relations.ideal.c_f(gamma, pe_p0, pa_p0, Ae_Astar)

Compute the ideal thrust coefficient C_F

Parameters:

  • gamma (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ratio of specific heats (must be > 1)

  • pe_p0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Exit-to-chamber pressure ratio p_e/p_0 (must be in [0, 1))

  • pa_p0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ambient-to-chamber pressure ratio p_a/p_0 (must be in [0, 1))

  • Ae_Astar (float or numpy.ndarray) – Nozzle area ratio A_e/A* (must be >= 1)

Returns:

Thrust coefficient C_F (dimensionless)

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Notes

Formula (PDF Eq. 2):
C_F = sqrt( (2*gamma^2/(gamma-1)) * (2/(gamma+1))^((gamma+1)/(gamma-1))

  • (1 - (p_e/p_0)^((gamma-1)/gamma)) ) + (p_e/p_0 - p_a/p_0)*(A_e/A*)

rocket_relations.ideal.c_star(gamma, R, T0)

Compute the ideal characteristic velocity c*

Parameters:

  • gamma (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ratio of specific heats (must be > 1)

  • R (float or numpy.ndarray) – Specific gas constant [J/(kg*K)] (must be > 0)

  • T0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Stagnation (total) temperature [K] (must be > 0)

Returns:

Characteristic velocity c* [m/s]

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Notes

Formula (PDF Eq. 1):

c* = sqrt( (1/gamma) * ((gamma+1)/2)^((gamma+1)/(gamma-1)) * R * T0 )

Module contents

rocket_relations package

This package provides tools for evaluating ideal rocket performance metrics based on standard ideal flow assumptions.

rocket_relations.c_f(gamma, pe_p0, pa_p0, Ae_Astar)

Compute the ideal thrust coefficient C_F

Parameters:

  • gamma (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ratio of specific heats (must be > 1)

  • pe_p0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Exit-to-chamber pressure ratio p_e/p_0 (must be in [0, 1))

  • pa_p0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ambient-to-chamber pressure ratio p_a/p_0 (must be in [0, 1))

  • Ae_Astar (float or numpy.ndarray) – Nozzle area ratio A_e/A* (must be >= 1)

Returns:

Thrust coefficient C_F (dimensionless)

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Notes

Formula (PDF Eq. 2):
C_F = sqrt( (2*gamma^2/(gamma-1)) * (2/(gamma+1))^((gamma+1)/(gamma-1))

  • (1 - (p_e/p_0)^((gamma-1)/gamma)) ) + (p_e/p_0 - p_a/p_0)*(A_e/A*)

rocket_relations.c_star(gamma, R, T0)

Compute the ideal characteristic velocity c*

Parameters:

  • gamma (float or numpy.ndarray) – Ratio of specific heats (must be > 1)

  • R (float or numpy.ndarray) – Specific gas constant [J/(kg*K)] (must be > 0)

  • T0 (float or numpy.ndarray) – Stagnation (total) temperature [K] (must be > 0)

Returns:

Characteristic velocity c* [m/s]

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Notes

Formula (PDF Eq. 1):

c* = sqrt( (1/gamma) * ((gamma+1)/2)^((gamma+1)/(gamma-1)) * R * T0 )

API Reference

Usage Example

from rocket_relations import c_star, c_f

gamma = 1.2
R = 350
T0 = 3500

print(c_star(gamma, R, T0))
